contextId.information: These could be expressed as actions. AT: "to live in a pure way and to do what is right" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

The terms "baptism" and "repentance" could be stated as actions. AT: "and he preached that people should be baptized to show that they were repenting" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
"because of your faith, you have become well." "faith" could be stated as an action. AT: "because you believe, you are healed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: your faith has made you well

contextId.information: The abstract noun  "kingdom" can be expressed with the verbs "reign" or "rule." Possible meanings are 1) the kingdom of God will begin soon. AT: "God will soon rule everywhere as king" (UDB) or 2) the activities of kingdom of God are happening all around you. AT: "The proof that God is reigning is all around you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: The kingdom of God has come close to you

contextId.information: "Because of your faith you have become well." The idea of "faith" can be expressed with the verb "believe." AT: "Because you believe, you are well again" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: Your faith has made you well

contextId.information: It was understood that salvation comes from God. AT: "God has saved this household" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: salvation has come to this house
